intro: Fumana scoparia subsp. paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical fumana, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is adapted to arid environments and is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique floral structure and growth habits compared to other members of the genus.
